intro: Myrsine diminuta, commonly known as the dwarf myrsine, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters, with dense, glossy green leaves. Its small white flowers are followed by bright red berries that attract birds. Myrsine diminuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
